Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "CORS security: reflecting any origin header value when configured to *  is dangerous" (#3106) at aspnet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
When CORS policy is configured to `WithOrigins("*")`, asp.net CORS will actively convert it to reflect any Origin header value. This kind of behavior is dangerous and has caused many security problems in the past.

Some similar security issues:
[cyu/rack-cors#126](https://github.com/cyu/rack-cors/issues/126)
[https://nodesecurity.io/advisories/148](https://nodesecurity.io/advisories/148)

Some related blog posts:
[https://ejj.io/misconfigured-cors/](https://ejj.io/misconfigured-cors/)
[http://blog.portswigger.net/2016/10/exploiting-cors-misconfigurations-for.html](http://blog.portswigger.net/2016/10/exploiting-cors-misconfigurations-for.html)

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "AspNetCore 2.1-preview2 - System.Text.DecoderFallbackException" (#3105) at aspnet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
Hi,

I recently upgraded my code from asp.net core 2.0 to asp.net core 2.1-preview2. Since we upgraded we are encountering a crash in the production (for some requests) which never occurred before for the same code:

```
System.Text.DecoderFallbackException · Unable to translate bytes [C7] at index 829 from specified code page to Unicode.
System.Text.DecoderExceptionFallbackBuffer.Throw(byte[] bytesUnknown, int index)	
System.Text.DecoderExceptionFallbackBuffer.Fallback(byte[] bytesUnknown, int index)	
System.Text.DecoderFallbackBuffer.InternalFallback(byte[] bytes, Byte* pBytes, ref Char* chars)	
System.Text.UTF8Encoding.GetChars(Byte* bytes, int byteCount, Char* chars, int charCount, DecoderNLS baseDecoder)	
System.Text.DecoderNLS.GetChars(byte[] bytes, int byteIndex, int byteCount, char[] chars, int charIndex, bool flush)	
System.Text.DecoderNLS.GetChars(byte[] bytes, int byteIndex, int byteCount, char[] chars, int charIndex)	
Microsoft.AspNetCore.WebUtilities.HttpRequestStreamReader.ReadIntoBuffer()	
Microsoft.AspNetCore.WebUtilities.HttpRequestStreamReader.Read(char[] buffer, int index, int count)	
Newtonsoft.Json.JsonTextReader.ReadData(bool append, int charsRequired)	
Newtonsoft.Json.JsonTextReader.ParseValue()	
Newtonsoft.Json.JsonTextReader.Read()	
Newtonsoft.Json.JsonReader.ReadForType(JsonContract contract, bool hasConverter)	
Newtonsoft.Json.Serialization.JsonSerializerInternalReader.Deserialize(JsonReader reader, Type objectType, bool checkAdditionalContent)	
System.Runtime.ExceptionServices.ExceptionDispatchInfo.Throw()	
Microsoft.AspNetCore.Mvc.Formatters.JsonInputFormatter+<ReadRequestBodyAsync>d__17.MoveNext()	
System.Runtime.ExceptionServices.ExceptionDispatchInfo.Throw()	
System.Runtime.CompilerServices.TaskAwaiter.HandleNonSuccessAndDebuggerNotification(Task task)	
System.Runtime.CompilerServices.TaskAwaiter<TResult>.GetResult()	
Microsoft.AspNetCore.Mvc.ModelBinding.Binders.BodyModelBinder+<BindModelAsync>d__7.MoveNext()	
System.Runtime.ExceptionServices.ExceptionDispatchInfo.Throw()	
System.Runtime.CompilerServices.TaskAwaiter.HandleNonSuccessAndDebuggerNotification(Task task)	
Microsoft.AspNetCore.Mvc.ModelBinding.ParameterBinder+<BindModelAsync>d__11.MoveNext()	
System.Runtime.ExceptionServices.ExceptionDispatchInfo.Throw()	
System.Runtime.CompilerServices.TaskAwaiter.HandleNonSuccessAndDebuggerNotification(Task task)	
System.Runtime.CompilerServices.TaskAwaiter<TResult>.GetResult()	
Microsoft.AspNetCore.Mvc.Internal.ControllerBinderDelegateProvider+<>c__DisplayClass0_0+<<CreateBinderDelegate>g__Bind|0>d.MoveNext()	
System.Runtime.ExceptionServices.ExceptionDispatchInfo.Throw()	
System.Runtime.CompilerServices.TaskAwaiter.HandleNonSuccessAndDebuggerNotification(Task task)	
Microsoft.AspNetCore.Mvc.Internal.ControllerActionInvoker+<InvokeInnerFilterAsync>d__13.MoveNext()	
System.Runtime.ExceptionServices.ExceptionDispatchInfo.Throw()	
System.Runtime.CompilerServices.TaskAwaiter.HandleNonSuccessAndDebuggerNotification(Task task)	
Microsoft.AspNetCore.Mvc.Internal.ResourceInvoker+<InvokeNextExceptionFilterAsync>d__24.MoveNext()
```

It seems request parsing is failing which wasn't happening before. Can't even log the request model as crash occurs before the controller action is called.

Reopened issue "Flaky test: System_NoKeysDirectoryProvided_UsesDefaultKeysDirectory" (#3034) at aspnet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
This test [fails](http://aspnetci/viewLog.html?buildId=442272&tab=buildResultsDiv&buildTypeId=XPlat_Windows_Win10Universe#testNameId1329483692832033125) sometimes with the following error:

```
System.IO.IOException : Cannot create 'C:\Users\asplab\AppData\Local\ASP.NET\DataProtection-Keys' because a file or directory with the same name already exists.
   at System.IO.Directory.Move(String sourceDirName, String destDirName)
   at Microsoft.AspNetCore.DataProtection.DataProtectionProviderTests.System_NoKeysDirectoryProvided_UsesDefaultKeysDirectory() in C:\BuildAgent\work\33bdfc1cae7b2a38\modules\DataProtection\test\Microsoft.AspNetCore.DataProtection.Extensions.Test\DataProtectionProviderTests.cs:line 89
======= Failed test run #2 ==========
System.IO.IOException : Cannot create 'C:\Users\asplab\AppData\Local\ASP.NET\DataProtection-KeysTemp' because a file or directory with the same name already exists.
   at System.IO.Directory.Move(String sourceDirName, String destDirName)
   at Microsoft.AspNetCore.DataProtection.DataProtectionProviderTests.System_NoKeysDirectoryProvided_UsesDefaultKeysDirectory() in C:\BuildAgent\work\33bdfc1cae7b2a38\modules\DataProtection\test\Microsoft.AspNetCore.DataProtection.Extensions.Test\DataProtectionProviderTests.cs:line 55
```

Future instances of this failure can be tracked [here](http://aspnetci/project.html?projectId=XPlat&buildTypeId=&tab=testDetails&testNameId=1329483692832033125&order=TEST_STATUS_DESC&branch_XPlat=__all_branches__&itemsCount=50).

Events.RelatedBody:
Seen in this PR https://github.com/aspnet/SignalR/pull/2162

```
not ok 90 hubConnection over LongPolling it sends DELETE request and waits for poll to terminate
    ---

          message: (LongPolling transport) polling: http://127.0.0.1:4437/testhub?id=FfLyq9LR2aS8iZYv_YA1dQ&_=1525036821075
        - level: Trace
          timestamp: 2018-04-29T21:20:21.080Z
          message: (LongPolling transport) polling: http://127.0.0.1:4437/testhub?id=FfLyq9LR2aS8iZYv_YA1dQ&_=1525036821080
        - level: Debug
          timestamp: 2018-04-29T21:20:21.080Z
          message: Sending handshake request.
        - level: Trace
          timestamp: 2018-04-29T21:20:21.080Z
          message: (LongPolling transport) sending data. String data of length 32. Content: '{"protocol":"json","version":1}'..
        - level: Trace
          timestamp: 2018-04-29T21:20:21.084Z
          message: (LongPolling transport) request complete. Response status: 200.
        - level: Information
          timestamp: 2018-04-29T21:20:21.084Z

```

We should fix the ts client to do what the .NET client does and send the delete after the poll ends:
- Don't wait on the poll to terminate 
- Send delete after ending the poll

https://github.com/aspnet/SignalR/commit/d6395a52bc2de85d9513cb45cba3d9113c4d2a60#diff-ebcecff777de2ec17e8b72d021570c85

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "Simplify error handling in HubConnectionHandler" (#2162) at aspnet/SignalR
Events.RelatedBody:
- Since we execute hub methods inline, there's no need to abort the connection on unexpected exceptions.
- Don't pass the cancellation token to ReadAsync, instead just use CancelPendingRead.
- Don't treat OperationCancelledException errors as errors.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Can't accept multiple IFormFile" (#7719) at aspnet/Mvc
Events.RelatedBody:
Accepting a single `IFormFile` works fine, but when using `List<IFormFile>` or any other IFormFile collection type, the resulting collection is empty.

I'm using ASP.NET Core version 2.1.0-preview2-final on .NET Framework 4.6.2 on Windows.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "MvcRouteHandler and IActionContextAccessor" (#7718) at aspnet/Mvc
Events.RelatedBody:
I am having a problem when calling `UseMvc`. It says that it cannot resolve `MvcRouteHandler` because there is no `IActionContextAccessor` registered.

I have looked here: https://github.com/aspnet/Mvc/blob/599d1a502ef358678202345ced2d11ddca0754f3/src/Microsoft.AspNetCore.Mvc.Core/DependencyInjection/MvcCoreServiceCollectionExtensions.cs#L260

I can see that indeed `MvcRouteHandler` is registered as a service, but `IActionContextAccessor` isn't.

Please can you clarify how / where `IActionContextAccessor` get's registered?

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Custom ComplexTypeModelBinder doesn't work properly for Api Controllers or i do something wrong?" (#7707) at aspnet/Mvc
Closed issue "2fa recovery code is not working (invalid)" (#1770) at aspnet/Identity
Events.RelatedBody:
Hi,
Seems there is an issue with 2fa recovery code as it's not working.
1. Create a new ASP.NET Core Web project with built-in authentication, and deploy the db as default schema
2. Create a new user, and enable it's 2fa by using Microsoft Authentication app or Google's, copy the 2fa recovery code
3. Log out, and re-Log in, but use the 2fa recovery code to reset the 2fa settings, then you can get the error message

netcoreapp2.0
Microsoft.AspNetCore.All            Version="2.0.6" 
Microsoft.EntityFrameworkCore.Tools          Version="2.0.2"

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Migration Table name override not honored" (#1774) at aspnet/Identity
Events.RelatedBody:
_From @snovak7 on April 27, 2018 20:25_

First I create my custom DbContext

```c#
public class DbContext : 
    IdentityDbContext<User, Role, Guid, UserClaim, UserRole, UserLogin, RoleClaim, UserToken> {}
```

My User looks like this

```c#
[Table("MyCustomUser", Schema = "users")]
    public class User : IdentityUser<Guid> {}
```

I setup environment that I can generate my migration code.
For the test case I included Schema, which worked...

```c#
            migrationBuilder.CreateTable(
```

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Http Status Code 204 failing with empty content" (#2530) at aspnet/KestrelHttpServer
Events.RelatedBody:
Service A calls Service B => Service B returns 204. On the Service A when EnsureSucessStatusCode is invoked it adds empty Content which then fails from Kestrel.
Writing to the response body is invalid for responses with status code 204.

 at Microsoft.AspNetCore.Server.Kestrel.Core.Internal.Http.Frame.HandleNonBodyResponseWrite()
   at Microsoft.AspNetCore.Server.Kestrel.Core.Internal.Http.Frame.<WriteAsyncAwaited>d__199.MoveNext()
--- End of stack trace from previous location where exception was thrown ---
   at System.Runtime.ExceptionServices.ExceptionDispatchInfo.Throw()
   at System.Runtime.CompilerServices.TaskAwaiter.HandleNonSuccessAndDebuggerNotification(Task task)
   at Microsoft.AspNetCore.ResponseCompression.BodyWrapperStream.<WriteAsync>d__32.MoveNext()
--- End of stack trace from previous location where exception was thrown ---
   at System.Runtime.ExceptionServices.ExceptionDispatchInfo.Throw()
   at System.Runtime.CompilerServices.TaskAwaiter.HandleNonSuccessAndDebuggerNotification(Task task)
   at System.Net.Http.HttpContent.<CopyToAsyncCore>d__44.MoveNext()
--- End of stack trace from previous location where exception was thrown ---
   at Sy


To have a workaround we need to explicitly add the following where the Content is null and it works fine.

 if( response.StatusCode.Equals(HttpStatusCode.NoContent))
                    {
                        var response =new HttpResponseMessage(HttpStatusCode.NoContent);
                        return response;
                    }

Ask for Kestrel to ignore the Conent if the status code is 204. Or dotnet services should not add the content by default on 204 status code.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Make tooling support splitting asp.net and bootstrapping in different projects (onion architecture)" (#823) at aspnet/Tooling
Events.RelatedBody:
I'd like to see better tooling support for a more onion architecture like solution structure.

For instance
- Solution
  - Core (business logic, domain model, etc)
  - Infrastructure.EntityFramework (DAL)
  - Presentation.ASPNET (MVC or WebApi)
  - Bootstrapper (Program.cs and Startup.cs)

So basically I just moved Program.cs and Startup.cs to another project. This is important because according to the onion architecture Presentation.ASPNET should not have references to Entity Framework.

If I do this today I loose the "IIS Express" run button and I cannot publish via wed deploy in the way I'm used to. Plus a ton of other issues.

Would be sweet if there was better support for this setup :)
